Title.evidence: Ischemic mitral regurgitation (IMR) presents a clinical challenge amidst evolving treatment paradigms, particularly when accompanied by coronary artery disease (CAD).

Intervention.evidence: Studies encompassing varied interventions, including coronary revascularization and concomitant mitral valve procedures, were scrutinized to gauge their impact on patient outcomes.

Harms.evidence: However, the Cardiothoracic Surgical Trials Network (CTSN) trials raised concerns regarding adverse events and recurrence rates post-mitral repair.
